website_summaries.verdict: This heated mattress pad has a number of features and one frustrating design flaw.
pros: There are 10 total heat settings to choose from as well as a dual-zone control
cons: An awkwardly placed plug leaves some consumers needing to cut a hole in their bed skirt to get to the opening

customer_reviews.title: Pad works well, but I suggest another model.
customer_reviews.text: The mattress pad works well, after all it is a Sunbeam... I really dislike the control. The knob I find is difficult to grab hold of and difficult to turn, usually requiring both hands, one for the knob and the other hand to support the base. In bed, you cannot see the setting without setting up or rising enough to 'look down'. Sunbeam has, I just discovered, another model with a ComfortTech Controller - Control 'tap' buttons on the top, a display on the side. This model has a preheat button which the one I have is lacking. When I replace the one I have, I will 'upgrade' to the 'better model' and 'friendlier control'.
customer_reviews.author: ReggieF

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!
customer_reviews.text: I initially loved this mattress pad, but it lasted less than a year. The lights on the controller started flashing, like in many other reviews, and nothing anyone suggested fixed it. I unplugged it, during which time my puppy chewed through the controller cord. I contacted Sunbeam via their website about buying another set of controllers, but never heard a word back. Not only is this a poor quality heated mattress pad, but customer service is non-existent.
customer_reviews.author: Roo

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than a year
customer_reviews.text: Lasted less than a year before the controllers started blinking and the pad no longer heated. It started as just one side with the issue but now both sides are impacted. Not impressed and would never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Keeps me warm all night.
customer_reviews.text: Thus far, this has kept me warm each and every night. I keep it at a level 3 when I'm sleeping. Before I go to bed, I crank it up to an 8 or 9, just to get my bed nice and cozy. Because I have this heated mattress pad, I do not have to run the furnace at night and I live in a very cold part of the country. I sleep straight through the night - I never wake up cold/uncomfortable. Only drawback ... my dogs also love it and they will burrow in to get warm. Just buy this thing - it'll keep you and your pets happy and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Vesta

customer_reviews.title: Fire hazard. Doesn’t  worth the risk!
customer_reviews.text: I used to like this pad, but after a few months it stopped working. Amazon replaced it but a week later, while using it I noticed a burning smell and It stopped working. When I removed the heating pad I noticed a black burnt in the heating pad and in my mattress. It could have been a very very bad situation if my mattress would have catch fire! Doesn’t worth the risk.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: I washed it once following the instruction exactly and it ...
customer_reviews.text: I washed it once following the instruction exactly and it didn’t work any more. I contacted the customer service, and they were willing to send a new one AFTER we send the old one back paying the postage ourselves. I would have thought they’d send a return postage label and a new one so we can send the old one back using that box. I’m not too impressed with the quality, warranty, and the customer service.
customer_reviews.author: K. Mueller

customer_reviews.title: No more cold toes or sore back
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended to me by my massage therapist as I was always commenting on how comfy laying on their warm table felt.I wish I would've bought this sooner! I no longer wake up with a stiff back and I no longer dread climbing into my cold sheets, this is the first time I've actually been looking forward to winter. The only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars is because the place the cord plugs in is right where your head or feet would go and it is super uncomfortable and hard but I found an old sheet and just cut it a bit, folded in it several times to make a comfier spot.
customer_reviews.author: Eden A.

customer_reviews.title: Practical and amazing purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly for my wife as she has been undergoing leukemia treatment and has times where she is really cold and has been colder than normal for quite sometime. Instead of me melting from the furnace this is an awesome way to keep her warm at night without affecting my side. We have had this mattress pad for about 4 months now and has held up great. We have a mastiff that likes to sleep with us and has held up wonderfully. I like the ability to turn my side on if I get cold or am in need of a heating pad.
customer_reviews.author: travis

customer_reviews.title: It not only feels good and warm but it allowed me to sleep all night without back pain.
customer_reviews.text: I was unsure how this would work. I've only had the electric blankets. I have so much faith in the sunbeam company I thought I'd try it. Its incredible. I have sever injuries to my back and neck and it helps ease those ache and pains. It didn't even cross my mind that it would help that. I can only say thank you to the company for making it easier to sleep all night without those pains.
customer_reviews.author: Meldy

customer_reviews.title: Immediately had problem
customer_reviews.text: This heated mattress cover was more comfortable than others I’ve had. Can’t feel the wires when lying on it. BUT, the very first night I turned it on to warm up the bed, the right side of the bed stopped working and the control started flashing. I unpluged the blanket and turned it back on. It continued to work properly the rest of the night. This continues to happen at least two nights a week. Sometimes several times in one evening. I didn’t return it because at this time of the year it’s a necessity.
customer_reviews.author: Grits

customer_reviews.title: It has a expiration date!
customer_reviews.text: This is the thing I have purchased this pad. When functional great product for price. However the two times I purchased it. Once in 2017 the other Oct 8 2018....(thanks to order history) the element on one side went out or does not heat to capacity. It’s not being used in summer months. So your getting only a few months active service. So you ask why I purchased agin! $6.17 Asurion! Protection Plan. Which I called today! They require return of the product by way of UPS at there expense. Problem solved. Credit back to Amazon for full price.
customer_reviews.author: Cary  Bridgeford

customer_reviews.title: Wife is hotter than the Sun- just not as bright....
customer_reviews.text: Excellent item. Makes you feel like you are laying on a heating pad for your body. Def better than an electric blanket. Dual zones makes my very cold wife super happy... I can lower the temperature on my side to a comfortable level while her side is boiling hotter than the sun during a solar flare. Serious... a great product for those cold winter nights. I can now keep the heat in my house at 58 degrees while my wife remains snug as a bug on the surface of the sun. So if you want to keep your heat low w/o your significant other complaining, buy this product and save $$$$$$ on the heating bills.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Dave in the Stab Lab

customer_reviews.title: Defective out of box
customer_reviews.text: Returned for replacement. One side did not work out of the box. The light just flashes, indication poor connection or other issue. Unplugging and plugging back in restores function very briefly. Update: Second consecutive double side version, defective out of the box. One side works great, the other side work occasionally but usually just blinks. I expect more from such a well known brand. Returning for refund rather than replacement this time.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Failed and not a 5 year warranty
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this the Amazon page listed it as a 5 year warranty and it actually still shows "Limited 5 year warranty" down in the specs but 1 year warranty near the top. If I had taken the time to open the PDF I would have seen that Sunbeam only warranties this product for one year. Purchased in 2017, one side stopped working in 2019 and now that we've put it on for 2020 - neither side gets warm. Will be staying away from this once-great American brand that I fear has fallen victim to globalization, bankruptcy, acquisitions, and streamlining.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly T

customer_reviews.title: not functioning correctly
customer_reviews.text: woke up to the "OneSet" flashing. Next day read the frequetly asked questions. "Controls are designed to notify you in the event that a problem has been discovered by flashing the light on the control". Followed all the instructions to correct the problem. Instructions also say "If the product still does not operate after 2 or 3 times trying to reset, disconnect the power cord and contact Consumer Care". This is when I hate buying from Amazon. They need to send me a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Soft and warm
customer_reviews.text: Love heated blankets and mattress pads. These are soft and warm that give off an even heat weather soft or preheat the bed to crawl into on cold nights you just cant beat it! The material is so soft and thick I do not feel the wires. The controllers easy to use and stays on all night. The soft light is not distracting. I have been buying these for years. Every couple of years needed to buy new ones. They seem to just fail. This year seem different. Everything about them seems to be upgraded. I will keep my fingers crossed. They do come with a good warranty and I do recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph F.

customer_reviews.title: Warming my bed for 3 years and counting!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased the Sunbeam Heated Mattress Pad in Twin, Full, and King (one for each bed!), and all of them have lasted three years and counting. I was worried the bumps where the wires are sewn in would bother us, since we have some sensory processing issues. Luckily, they are not very pronounced and with soft sheets over it we have no complaints. Some reviews mention uneven heating, but in my experience if I put a blanket over it so the heat won't escape into the cold air, I feel the warmth quickly. I have not had any electric issues with any of the pads.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: From day 1 the wife’s side of the blanket will ...
customer_reviews.text: From day 1 the wife’s side of the blanket will heat for a short time and then the controller starts blinking and it stops heating. Tried all the trouble shooting we could find online and still doesn’t work. Wife contacted sunbeam weeks ago and has yet to receive a response.
customer_reviews.author: chad r schwegel

customer_reviews.title: So nice from head to toe !
customer_reviews.text: We bought a conventional mattress to replace the waterbed that we had (that I hated). My husband missed the heated part of the waterbed, so I got this to replace that feature for him. It works out for both of us with the dual controls. I ended up loving it myself. So nice to get into a nice warm bed ! Good safety feature that it turns off after 10 hours, but we're pretty good at turning it off as soon as we get up. I would recommend this seller and their products.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Stop working after a week please don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: It worked for a week and stopped working the control light is flashing and the mattress pad stop producing heat ! I have been shopping on Amazon for very long time , and I always post honest reviews , Please Amazon do something , these mattress pads for very short time and people pay a good amount of money for these !
customer_reviews.author: I only give honest review

customer_reviews.title: You feel the wires
customer_reviews.text: You sill feel the wires even with a good mattress pad. This may be a dealbreaker for some. Only way to find out is try it out! I'm still deciding... it's been 4 months. The on /off button is a toggle on so you can't hook up to a wifi smart switch and schedule when to turn on.That was a disappointment. As others have mentioned there's huge plastic box at the bottom of the pad. Couldn't they have put this on the side so you don't kick it? The heat is nice and even. I usually use on low. GF uses her side on high. It's nice to have dual zones.
customer_reviews.author: Barb Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Arrived on time and great packaging. Unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and great packaging. Unfortunately, it does not heat as it should. As the owner of 2 other Sunbeam electric warmers, I know it is just a defective one. These are a perfect way to stay warm throughout the cold Wintry nights without having to keep the heater on too very high. This works so much more effectively than an electric blanket (heat rises); I can warm my sheets before I climb into bed and stay warm all night. The merchant is handling this situation accordingly, and I appreciate it.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: I wish I hadn't bought this model!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th Sunbeam heated mattress pad I've purchased over the years, and it is the last one! Our others were all. problem-free for long use. This one is awful from the first night. The biggest problem is the plug is on TOP of the mattress instead of at the end of the bed. My foot hits it all night long. It is slower to heat. up than the others we have had. It is a poor design!
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Warranty terms are a joke
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this product for under 3 years and now the right side does not heat. Contacted Sunbeam for a warranty claim, and while it is under warranty, they insist I ship this back to them at my expense, wait 3-4 WEEKS for them to attempt to repair my failing pad, and then receive a repair or replacement. I live in the Northeast where we are having winter temperatures. There is no way to expedite. Shipping will cost me upwards of $20 on a $60 product. I have to wonder if they ship my "repaired" mattress pad back to me, how long it will be until the other side breaks. SAVE YOUR MONEY, BUY A DIFFERENT BRAND.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole S.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in Oct 2018 and in Jan 2019 it stopped heating on one side and one of the controllers blinks nonstop. You have to unplug the thing to make it stop. You can't reach ANYBODY at their "customer service" number and they don't reply to email to address the warranty issue. I wish Amazon could address this issue with their warranty.
customer_reviews.author: DEB

customer_reviews.title: Incredible, comfortable, controllable warmth!
customer_reviews.text: This is hands-down one of the best purchases we've ever made on Amazon! My wife is always cold, and I'm always warm, and with the dual controls, this is like a dream come true for bed time! She gets to preheat her side and climb into a nice cozy bed, and I get to have my side nice and cool! We are also able to save money by keeping the thermostat set much lower on the heating system overnight. It works very well, heats up quickly, and has a nice even warmth without feeling bulky wires digging into you. This heating pad is absolutely worth every penny we spent on it and then some, considering the money saved on utilities!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: Pros: You will never be cold in bed again. Cons: Clunky control mechanism that is difficult to turn Plug-in is on top of the mattress at the foot of the bed so you kick it all night long (and its big and thick too) Even on Low, it gets too hot in a couple of hours. I am usually cold, so I was pretty shocked to wake up in the middle of the night because my bed was too warm. I know use it to warm up the bed and then turn it off completely when I go to sleep. I would not recommend this product. It's ok for a guest bed but not your own to use every night.
customer_reviews.author: mkell37

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly quality product from sunbeam, but...
customer_reviews.text: The product works great, heats up, and allows for the inside temperature of the house to comfortably drop to 56 degrees f. I was worried because other sunbeam products I have purchased have not been of acceptable in quality. This product is. We are going 2 years strong. Having said that, I highly encourage you to look elsewhere before purchasing. Certain big box stores that are not allowed to be mentioned here are selling them for 38.88 - that's roughly 20 less than when I bought it here 2 years ago,and the current amount of roughly 60.
customer_reviews.author: Lee B

customer_reviews.title: Bought new got used
customer_reviews.text: I got the sunbeam quilted polyester heated mattress pad from amazon on December 6, 2016. I didn't open the package until today September 13, 2017. Upon opening the package I found blood spots on the mattress, and it had been washed. I could tell this by looking at the tag, which was wrinkled and faded. I then plugged in the power supply and it did NOT WORK. I tried outlets that I know are good, It is just bad. I would have though that Amazon would send new, clean product , To much time has elapsed to send it back. Check your Amazon orders as soon as you get them. It sneaky to pass off used as new.
customer_reviews.author: Lee M.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! It's a lifesaver for my husband and I who just moved from Florida to Illinois. We're not used to any of the upcoming winter temperatures and it's so nice to get into a warm bed at night. My husband uses it every single night. He's obsessed. One thing we did differently is I placed the plug in at our heads rather than feet. Since it's under our pillows, it's never uncomfortable and it reaches the outlets better.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn

customer_reviews.title: So cozy!!
customer_reviews.text: This mattress cover fits perfect and has nice deep pockets so it fits over my foam mattress topper completely. And this baby can put off some heat!! I love that is dual temperature controlled because most times I like heat and my husband does not LOL but I bought it because we live way up in the mountains and the winters can be brutally freezing. I think this is going to keep us nice and toasty. The heat distributes evenly and I have not had any issues with any heat spots on the coils like you normally get with heating pads sometimes. So far it’s working great and I think it was a great value
customer_reviews.author: Kristie Rivera

customer_reviews.title: When it worked it was great.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't last 30 days. A couple of days ago the controller for one side started flashing and would not get warm. It also does not turn off when this happens. The Sunbeam web site said to unplug it to reset. This worked for one night. Now it starts blinking within a few moments of turning it on. I had hoped to get a few years out of this, not a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Edward M Tourigny

customer_reviews.title: Best. Invention
customer_reviews.text: Best. Invention. Ever. Of all the presents I've given my wife, this decidedly unglamorous heated mattress pad may be one of her favorite things - though it probably encourages her to sleep in longer than she should. The dual controls are handy - I prefer my side of the bed cooler than she does, and the controls work as you'd expect. The temperature can get quite hot, particularly under comforters, and I rarely find it necessary to go above the first two settings. The pad is easy to put on, and I've had no problems with it coming off. I'm also saving money on heating bills with being able to turn the temperature down further at night.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Skove

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Friends we visit overnight have a mattress topper in their guest room. They said they just use it on their bed to warm up the mattress when they first go to bed. I like to be warm. I got one of these for us for Christmas. I keep it on the lowest setting all night ! One of the best items I have purchased. Great for my lower back problems. Plus it has an automatic off after 10 hours if I forget to turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: David A.

customer_reviews.title: I love it! One star taken off as the first ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it! One star taken off as the first one didn't work and needed to be returned. I can't recommend contacting 'customer service' at Sunbeam. I tried to call, they were too busy to even have me wait on hold. I used their chat system and found the experience frustrating at best. I turn my side on 4 before going to bed to heat up our memory foam mattress and then turn it off as soon as I get in. Soooooo nice to get into a warm bed. Helps me avoid waking up sweaty because of having too many blankets on when first going to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. J

customer_reviews.title: It's a great heated mattress pad. It will almost certainly die in a year or two.
customer_reviews.text: Consider these mattress pads disposable. Years ago, I had an electric blanket that lasted at least a decade. I replaced it with one that lasted a year. Then I switched to mattress pads. I've gone through at least 5 in the last 6 years: Nov. 2014; Dec. 2016; Aug. 2017; Oct. 2018; now. They work fine until they don't work at all. I've bought more expensive pads; they don't last any longer. This one is fine. Next year, I'll buy another one. If someone made one that would last 5 years, I would pay more for it.
customer_reviews.author: VLD

customer_reviews.title: It gets cold but Whoa!
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE unless you live in an area that gets 20 below zero you don't need to set the temperature above Low. The heat gets trapped under your body so it gets contained really well. I like also that it's dual zoned (I bought the queen) because while I am freezing, my husband sleeps on top of the blankets with the ceiling fan on high complaining of how hot it is. So we can both be comfortable. I also like it how I don't have to pack it away every summer unlike a blanket and I don't have to question whether it is right side up so I don't turn it on think it's my side and it be wrong.
customer_reviews.author: CherryAngel

customer_reviews.title: Shoulda bought one years ago
customer_reviews.text: We all lust for heated car seats right? Why not heated matresses? Put this on your bed under the sheets, throw the blanket on top, set it to 5 about 20 min before bed, then if your like me and hate sleeping with socks on imagine climbing into a pre warmed bed. Its hard not to get a big stupid grin on your face. We all hate leaving the bed in the AM because its all warm and cozy feeling - why not get it that way to go to sleep at night? crank it up to 7 or 8 if youve got a stiff back or shoulders, works wonders for that.
customer_reviews.author: Mrguy

customer_reviews.title: Pay a little more for a superior product.
customer_reviews.text: Why didn’t I believe them? Many other reviews noted that theirs stopped working after a short amount of time, and so did mine. The phone number in my warranty is out of service, and via Google, I found another, only to be shuffled around phone tree hell. Sunbeam, you won this round. I went and bought a pricier heated mattress pad, from a different company. But I won’t be buying Sunbeam products again.
customer_reviews.author: Nuin

customer_reviews.title: This definitely keeps you warm at night!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for cold winter nights - 9 degrees - and will do that. But it is almost too warm; I have it on 4 and have to turn it off in the middle of the night because its too warm. In the mornings its always undone at the corners and has to be pulled down. That and the control knobs are not the easiest to use; they are rather stiff to go between numbers. Overall I do like it - that's why I gave it a 4 rating - but I wish it was just more 'user friendly'.
customer_reviews.author: Colybean

customer_reviews.title: Excellent heated mattress pad
customer_reviews.text: This pad is dryer safe, unlike others made with cheap hard plastic connectors. The fit on a true queen size mattress was excellent - edge to edge coverage of the main part of the pad. The 17" side panels were more than sufficient to keep the pad in place. For $50, can not go wrong. As it is made in China, there is that small concern, but it is a 'name brand' pad. The one I sent back (two of them in fact - not these) were some other brand that had several severe issues. So far, very happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: неизвестный

customer_reviews.title: Garbage product, garbage customer service, garbage company.
customer_reviews.text: Crapped out a year after I bought it. Barely heats up. If I want it remotely warm, I have to put it between level eight to ten. Anything below and it might as well not even be on. I had to contact Sunbeam Customer Care three times to even get a response. When I did, their responses are so few and far between that the whole ordeal has been going on since November 2018. It's now mid January 2019, and they want me to ship my product to them at my expensive, and wait ANOTHER month to maybe get it back, possibly with repairs. I wouldn’t waste your time with this product. I'd get another brand any day over sunbeam.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Flashing controls nuisance.
customer_reviews.text: It heats well. The BIGGEST problem is keeping the cord “free” so the controls do not start flashing. This has happened several times. The last two times the cord was barely “confined “. I made sure the cord was not touching anything. Once I unplugged the cord from the outlet and unplugged it from the blanket then waited a few hours, then Replugged everything. I turned the controls on. They were not flashing and was heating the bed as it should. If the sensitivity of the cord would be improved I would recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Linda R.

customer_reviews.title: Life is good with 2 zones and wife is happy
customer_reviews.text: Love it. No problems so far after a month or so. My wife uses her side and stays warm at the low setting. I climb in and cuddle up with her and then move away when I get hot. Nice to have 2 zones. I only used my side once,( being warm blooded more than her). I try and remember to turn hers up to high before we go to bed to get her side warmed up then turn it all the way down to low for the rest of the night. The 8 hour timer is great. You can't forget to turn it off that way.
customer_reviews.author: Norman

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: We have had this heated mattress pad for a couple weeks now and are very pleased with it. It is soft to lay on, comfortable in that you don't feel the wires, and the duel controls allow comfort settings for each of us. We had to turn ours so the plug is at the top and it didn't matter as far as the way it heated the bed. I'm hoping that the wires, after use, is still comfortable to lay on. I'll up date after having it a while.
customer_reviews.author: Dottie C

customer_reviews.title: Plenty warm for cold nights.
customer_reviews.text: Gets HOT! I only use it on the "2" setting and it's plenty warm. They still haven't solved the fitment problems but it's much better than older models. One quibble, unlike the old model this unit is not compatible with AC timers. I used to be able to set up a timer to turn on the bed heat a half hour before bedtime so the bed was always warm on cold nights. The new "smarter" controller cannot be used in this way. Another ding, it automatically turns off after ten hours so if you watch TV before nodding off and sleep in, you'll be chilly when you get up.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Warm. Excellent Value for money.
customer_reviews.text: What’s important: It warms very very well. You can’t feel the wires. My only gripe: There is a cold spot at the bottom where my feet end up that isn’t on my partners side. Right where the safety label is. That is unfortunate. Exchanged it. Same thing in the second. Bottom line: you can’t beat performance for the price. This works to keep us really warm in Vermont winters. I am not even slightly disappointed given the price of the item.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Krumenacker

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy. The controls blinked and there was no heat. I followed the online instructions to unplug, let it rest and replug. No change. I repeated this 5 times. Same. I had to leave a message with Sunbeam because no one will speak with you on the phone. Left a message at 9 AM when they said the help line opened.. And I am. still waiting for a response @ 10 AM. Forget it. I'm sending it back and trying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: nancy kalinowski

customer_reviews.title: One side failed
customer_reviews.text: One side of the heating has ceased functioning just after it exited the Amazon return window.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Jeffries

customer_reviews.title: Great heated pad!
customer_reviews.text: The heated mattress pads takes a while to warm up. Much slower than the Sunbeam products I've had in the past. Didn't bother returning it due to the low price compared to other mattress pads. The pad eventually gets warm enough for me, sometimes too warm even when its on a lower settings. I love the duel controls. I'm always cold and my husband always complains or being too hot. He ca. Decide if he wants to use the pad at all or just use a low setting without complaining that I make him sweat! 4 stars for the long time it takes to warm up.
customer_reviews.author: Christine C

customer_reviews.title: Works fine when it works!
customer_reviews.text: The controls for this mattress pad blink on and off all too often. The directions say that this means there is something wrong with the connection. I have had to plug and unplug the unit several times on a few occasions to get it to work again. Once it works, it's just fine, but the blinking lights do cause me distress.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Y.

customer_reviews.title: I unplugged it for 1min and then it was good to go
customer_reviews.text: I can't sleep all night with this thing on anything above a 4 setting because it puts out some serious heat- I guess that is the point. There is no doubt it will save me money this Winter on the electric bill because I will not have to keep the house so warm when I sleep. I did have an issue with it not turning on after I left it run for half a day- it has on auto shut off. I unplugged it for 1min and then it was good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big, bulky, annoying connector in the way of your feet.
customer_reviews.text: Did not even try it after putting on bed because the big, bulky connector was at the bottom of the bed, six inches in from the end of the mattress, by the feet and was so big and bulky and annoying that did not even want to try it. Our old one had a small connectors on the very top of the heating pad that was out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: C. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I've done for myself
customer_reviews.text: I have severe arthritis in my spine in my legs. And in my hands. I suffer with great pain, especially in the morning trying to get moving. I should have got this heated mattress pad years ago. It is a thousand times better. Then heated blanket because on this pad you have all of your body weight pressing down into this heat and it just permeates every cell. And bone in your body. It has really increase the flow of blood so that I can get moving in the morning with ease. Believe me. This is worth its weight or more in gold. .
customer_reviews.author: valerie

customer_reviews.title: Uneven Heating after 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: I bought another pad after this one gave out in two years. Maybe that's all they are supposed to last. Dunno.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We've used heated mattress pads in the past and they worked well. Not the case with this one. It's uncomfortably hot in some places, barely warm in other places. I've tried turning it with no difference in results. It has a soft luxurious feel to it, but does not stay in place well on the bed. Material on the sides is too stretchy. I would not recommend buying it
customer_reviews.author: Rae

customer_reviews.title: Great for those cold blooded members of the family.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my mom, who I suspect is a lizard person. She loves it and uses it as a regular mattress pad even when it's not cold out. It doesn't seem to take much electricity. Works great! WARNING!- they all seem to say machine washable but the few that I've owned in the past never seem to survive more than a couple of washes. I'd recommend placing this under a mattress protector to prevent it from getting dirty in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor sleeper loves this pad
customer_reviews.text: Outdoor sleeper loves this pad. I have a Sunbeam blanket, and between the two I am toasty, without heavy blankets to bind up my feet. I do use a down duvet. Both are set fairly low. Temperature now is not below 32 degrees F., but will get much lower later on. I use this setup on an air mattress, queen size.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Luftig

customer_reviews.title: Everything I wanted it to be!
customer_reviews.text: How did I even survive winter before I bought this heated mattress pad!? I can't even tell you - because this thing is pure heaven. I just turn it on about 30 minutes before we go to bed (I keep mine on 6, and my husband's side is at a 4) and then I turn it off once we climb in. It works so well, and you can't even tell you're laying on it. You can't feel any of the wires in it, and it really added to the comfort of our bed. I haven't even needed to turn it all the way up to the highest setting because it's plenty warm. You wouldn't regret this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: K. B. Dailey

customer_reviews.title: Melted after 3 months light use.
customer_reviews.text: The product seemed fine, big bump where the cable enters the bottom and no timed shutoff. The problem is after 3 months of light use to warm up bed before getting in the bottom MELTED! This seems very dangerous. I am guessing many more are melted and people just have not checked. We were removing for spring and noticed the problem. Also they don’t answer the phone when you call.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M-E

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had mine for a month and use it every night to warm my bed !Love it. It does take longer to warm up than I thought it would but I just start it a little earlier . Turn it on before I Get tready for bed and by the time I get in, it’s warm enough. I also love the push button on the dial. The dial can be a little hard to turn back, but I always leave it on the same temperature. I can see that it might be a little bit difficult for someone elderly, or someone that has arthritis ... But that press button is easy easy easy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can absolutely feel ALL the wires!
customer_reviews.text: So, I am in love with my pillow top mattress, but I hate climbing into a cold bed. This heating pad heats wonderfully and fit over my extra deep pillow top, but it was stiff & I could feel ALL the wires. The extra long cords and outdated dial controllers were also cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: A Scott

customer_reviews.title: poor quality,  doesn't last long, buy a different item
customer_reviews.text: I used this heater for last winter and when I put it back on the bed now that its getting cold, only one side heats up....what a waste of 70 bux...smfh
customer_reviews.author: Tim Morgan

customer_reviews.title: My New Favorite Thing
customer_reviews.text: I went on a glamping trip and the luxury tents had heated mattress pads. I had never before used one. I researched on the internet and bought this product. I absolutely love climbing into a warm bed. I just use mine to heat up the bed and then turn it off once I am in the bed because it gets very warm. The pad has wires running thru it and i thought they might be uncomfortable, but I honestly don't even notice them. I loved the mattress pad so much I bought one for both my adult children. They both love the mattress pad as much as I do.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Mitchell-Huey

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY, SEE RECENT REVIEWS
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work first time I plugged it in, lights flashed on and off, plugged in and out a few times and it came on worked ok first night now flashes all the time on left side and never gets warm. Listen to the reviews I took a chance I’d be one of the good reviews after seeing multiple bad ones, I was wrong. Save yourself the hassle of being wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo

customer_reviews.title: Don't get cold feet
customer_reviews.text: Setup can be a bit finicky with running control wires and power cords around. Instructions are minimal. My first setup showed an error but disconnecting and reconnecting the controller rebooted (?) it and it's been working fine since. I use it on the lower settings to take the chill off a room in an old house with minimal insulation. Higher settings are hot enough to make me sweat. I have it under a sheet and, other than the heat, I don't notice that it's there.
customer_reviews.author: Dave P

customer_reviews.title: My wife and I really like this mattress pad
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I really like this mattress pad. It makes a getting into a cold bed a thing of the past. But I have to say that I expected it to be warmer. I remember the (probably cancer-causing) electric blanket I had as a kid that warmed up like a giant heating pad, and I guess I was expecting that. Not to much. The warmth here is much more subtle, and the "Hi" is a little underwhelming. But I love the fact that it's dual-zone, so the wife can have it on without affecting me, and it really does take the chill off.
customer_reviews.author: RMS401

customer_reviews.title: Loved it but..
customer_reviews.text: I love it , but.... My first one stopped working on me just kept blinking and not hearing , I suggest you buy the warranty!! It’s the only way to make sure you get your moneys worth , I didn’t for my first one and I got another one just bc that happened to me, It has two set controls for left and right side , perfect for couples that can’t agree on a setting !
customer_reviews.author: Nellie

customer_reviews.title: If I had only known.
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing, how I never tried this product before I don't know. I have used electric blankets in the past but this product IMHO is way better. I made the bed after installing the heated mattress pad by the easy to follow directions and turned the controls on set to the lowest heat. Turned the controls on about 15 minutes before bed time and when I got in and covered up with a light sheet and quilt it was heavenly. My spouse loves it too. Should have bought one years ago.
customer_reviews.author: pvf741

customer_reviews.title: Bad location of the plug. It's in the way of your feet.
customer_reviews.text: The plug for this is a ridiculously bad design. For the King size, it is at the feet in the center of the bed on top, so I am always hitting it with my feet. At 5'5", I thought I would be above it, but I am not. My advice is to look for a different brand that has a different plug situation. My last one had two, one in each of the upper right and left corners of the bed, so they were completely out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: These Seattle Girls

customer_reviews.title: So much better than a blanket
customer_reviews.text: Compared to electric blankets, this is far superior. Everyone knows heat rises, right? So with the toasty warm pad underneath you, the soothing heat rises around you as you sleep and keeps you nice and warm. Individual controls mean no debating settings with your partner. Just set your side where you like it, and they set theirs. Good price at Amazon on this one!
customer_reviews.author: dlh

customer_reviews.title: Warm, warm and warm!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is AMAZING!! I didn’t even realize that this was a thing until it was recommended to me on Amazon! It fits so nice on the mattress, it does not roll up which can be super annoying! Also, you can not feel the heated wiring which is something that I was worried about! The only thing I wish is that the 2 controls for each side were labeled but that is super small compared to how much I enjoy this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Clemens

customer_reviews.title: incorrectly made
customer_reviews.text: I have had these pads throughout my life, and the heating elements have alway stopped at the shoulder. This pad goes from the feet to the headboard. I had my side turned on "3" (out of 20) and woke up drenched. My room was 60 degrees with a ceiling fan on, and I woke up so hot I had to get up to cool off. The pad itself was well made and fit quite nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Buy it! You'll LOVE it
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I live in the northern climes, very chilly in the winter, it's nice to get in a warm bed, it makes it much easier to keep the thermostat down. I have 2, one king, one queen, I plan to buy more this winter. I'm not an electric blanket fan, the wires kinda bug me, but this system is OK. One problem is the cord to the controls is a bit too short for my liking, it's hard to keep the control on the night stand. I love these so much I now have one for my king and 3 queens...everyone stays warm!
customer_reviews.author: janesplace

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Heats quickly and we can't feel the wires at all. We've only had it a few weeks so we don't know how well it will hold up. We put the plugs at the "head" end of the bed so they're under the pillows and not noticeable at all .
customer_reviews.author: Cranky Old Man

customer_reviews.title: Fool me twice, shame on me
customer_reviews.text: I have had bad experiences with two of this exact same product. It does not last. Why I thought ordering second one would have a better outcome I have no idea. I would have returned the first one but it was past the return date when it stopped functioning. I thought maybe that was just a fluke so I ordered another one. That stopped functioning after about five uses. Do not order this product.
customer_reviews.author: Marge Sexton

customer_reviews.title: Ooooh, Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my memory foam mattress. I discovered that the mattress gets hard when it's cold. Now I can't seem to stay out of the bed. It's nice not having freezing cold feet. It has nice deep pockets and has room to fit below the mattress and not just on the side of it. I don't know how it will hold up over time or through a wash yet. It has two controllers so I don't have to heat up the bed for just me.
customer_reviews.author: Critter

customer_reviews.title: i live in Pennsylvania and this is a great way to stay warm while turning the thermostat down ...
customer_reviews.text: i live in Pennsylvania and this is a great way to stay warm while turning the thermostat down slightly at night. I cannot sleep comfortably if it is left on higher than setting 3, and the only time i have ever used high is to warm up the bed before i crawl into it. I wish the remotes were labeled as to which side they control, but that is an easy fix with a permanent marker. The quality is nice, the material is smooth and soft, and it fits my pillow top mattress well.
customer_reviews.author: Karli

customer_reviews.title: Amazon lied, said it was the same as one we ordered before.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon said this was the same item we purchased a few years ago. We ordered a new one as the old one quit working after several years of good service. Sadly, this unit is NOT THE SAME. The controllers on the old unit were backlit so that you could see the temp setting at night in a dark room. The new unit only has the power button backlit which is useless for setting temperature in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: noPRNDLhere

customer_reviews.title: Works for me! But very warm, no need for 10 levels!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this for almost 2 months and zero problems so far. My only complaint is that I don’t know who in their right mind can stand the heat from 3 and higher! I’m always cold, ALWAYS, but I honestly roast myself at 2 after awhile. Low is what I keep it at. So why even have 10 levels of heat??!! You couldn’t possibly use the higher levels!
customer_reviews.author: Contonio

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 3 months
customer_reviews.text: We really enjoyed this product while it worked. It made for a comfortable bed, but after we turned it off for the Summer (3 months after first using), it would not turn on when we attempted to use it again in the Fall. We reached out to Sunbeam customer service, who were initially responsive. After replying with what they requested (receipt and pictures of the product), it has been two months since I heard back from their customer service. Ultimately, a waste of money if the product is meant to only work for a few months time.
customer_reviews.author: Alaina

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Very nice item. I regretted not buying it earlier. My bronchitis was cured after using this every night, since I feel cold on my back. This heating mattress pad is actually way better than any heater. It actually warm up your body, not just the room. But if there's something needs to improve, it will be the heating control switch, it is pretty hard to turn at night if I want to turn it higher or lower.
customer_reviews.author: JCT886

customer_reviews.title: Comfort on cool evenings
customer_reviews.text: Our previous Sunbeam mattress pad heater was used throughout the cool months in Arizona and Oregon. It lasted over ten years. This is a direct replacement. The fit to our queen size mattress is perfect. The controls are easy to use. A rotary switch selects heat level -- 3 on the new pad is about as warm as 4 on the old one. The on/off button is improved. The new one is subtly backlit and does not disturb night vision.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Howard B. Bandy

customer_reviews.title: Poor Product Design
customer_reviews.text: Product quality seems good, needs time to confirm. But the product design is absolutely unreasonable. The place where the mattress contected to power is in the middle of buttom. Which means, If you're taller than 5 feet, your leg will frequently kick on the hard power connection on mattress. Even you get the power off, there's still some hard part on mattress which you can easily feel it by stretching legs. Really poor design. Why leave the power connection in the middle? Suggest anyone who's taller then 5 feet don't buy it
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Used all winter and still working perfectly
customer_reviews.text: The dual controls are a must for 2 people who sleep at different heat levels. They both work great as a preheat for the cold winter nights... one side set on L (the lowest) and the other side on 5. Heats up within 10-15 minutes. You can barely feel the cords. Neither of us are tall so the plug at the bottom doesn't bother us, but I could see how it would if your feet reached the bottom of the bed. It's definitely on top of the mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Meg and Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Only works for about the first 2-3 months.
customer_reviews.text: We are very disappointed in this mattress warmer. Although it fits the bed well, it does not warm up very much at all anymore. It worked fine for about the first month, then after that it seemed to take longer & longer to warm. We turn it on about 2-3 hours before going to bed and it’s barely warm. And I have my control turned up to the highest number it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Janna

customer_reviews.title: Once you experience a heated mattress pad, you’ll never go without.
customer_reviews.text: Once you experience a heated mattress pad, you’ll never go without. When my old one died (it had a good life considering the reality of planned obsolescence), I raced to find a replacement. Sunbeam’s heated mattress pad is excellent! Only issue: I wish they’d figure out a way to put the line connection on the side at the end of the mattress rather than on top such that feet won’t feel it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Uneven heat
customer_reviews.text: This product is OK. Been using it for a couple of weeks now and haven't had any major problems, but one annoying thing is that it does not heat evenly. A lot of times, there are cold spots and warm spots, and these aren't always in the same place every time so I don't know what the deal is with that. But it does take the edge off of getting into a cold bed (my bedroom is VERY cold, as I live in an old uninsulated house and the heat doesn't make it upstairs very well). Haven't tried washing it yet (I have regular sheets over top).
customer_reviews.author: Happy Girl

customer_reviews.title: So Disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 12/2017. When we got it, it was everything I dreamed of and I adored it. Now, after less than a year, it doesn't work properly. It only warms the part of the pad where it plugs into the cord, not the entire area as it did last winter. We washed it according to Manuf. instructiuons, then put it away for the season. When I got it out this season, pfft....Was hoping to be able to return it, but I don't see that as an option.
customer_reviews.author: Love MUSIC

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing I’ve ever spent money on. I highly recommend it. I put it on my mattress upside down but I still like it that way. It gets hotter at the “bottom” (where your feet are supposed to be) but I have no issues with it the wrong way. Lol the best part is I can sleep with the room super cold and just turn this on if I get a little chilly so I don’t have to change the temperature of the whole house and in the winter, I don’t have to crank the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Powell

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed in the product and even more so in the ...
customer_reviews.text: The heat controls on the mattress pad were not working properly. It got so warm I could only use it on the lowest setting, and that was even too warm. I wrote to the company, filled out all the information they requested, and 2 months later I still have not heard from them. Last night the controls on the mattress pad were blinking on and off, even though it wasn't in use and hadn't been used for over a month. The only way to stop the blinking was to unplug the unit from the wall socket. I am very disappointed in the product and even more so in the customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy S.

customer_reviews.title: Comfy sleep ever
customer_reviews.text: When I received this mattress pad I never expected it to be as comfortable to sleep on. As soon as you turn it on it gives you heat. You can set it as warm as you like. It has 10 heat settings, but I personally like to leave it on 1. It stays lightly warm all night. I turn it on before I get into bed and it’s so toasty when I get into bed I fall right to sleep. I’m so happy with my purchase. I would recommend this mattress to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Joann Politi

customer_reviews.title: So cozy!
customer_reviews.text: I love this!! I turn it on before I get ready for bed and then my bed is cozy and warm when I get into it. I don’t sleep with it on because my blankets are warm enough, I just like getting into a warm bed. (Note it does not have an auto shutoff option or timer- but the lowest setting is a very subtle warmth.)
customer_reviews.author: AKmandy

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Work's great. The only thing I don't like is that the plug is at the end on top of the bed, and I tend to feel it when I'm sleeping. Helps a lot with my Arthritis.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saved my marriage
customer_reviews.text: When I married my husband, I moved into the uninsulated, historic farmhouse he is renting. My pillow literally freezes to the wall. We tried using a heated blanket but it just wasn't doing the job. Because... HEAT RISES! Put the warmth under you! We stay nice and toasty warm in bed! Happily married <3
customer_reviews.author: Jax

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you warm but you better only sleep on one side of the bed
customer_reviews.text: I'm a tall guy, I have a queen size mattress and I sleep full-starfish. The plug coupling for this is right in the middle about 6 inches from the end of the pad which means either right under your pillow or right under the boniest part of your ankle, if you sleep in the middle of your bed this is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Warm and cozy!
customer_reviews.text: This mattress pad is so comfortable! I was very excited for dual controls. The heat is amazing on colder nights or for back pain if you’re like me. The cords are long enough to reach wherever you need them and I love the 10 hour shut off timer! This helps us keep down our gas bill! It will be amazing this winter!
customer_reviews.author: BCJ

customer_reviews.title: Dials are hard too grip
customer_reviews.text: Liked: 1. Thicked enough that wire connections do not rub or bother me 2. Even heat Problem: I cannot turn dials without using a textured cloth to grip them. My fingers slide off and I cannot change the temperature without something to help grip the dial. I am not sure if it is because I have small hands. Otherwise, it is a nice heated mattress pad.
customer_reviews.author: doc

customer_reviews.title: Will sweat you out of the bed! Great item!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mattress pad. The heat is perfectly adjustable. It will sweat you out on high! It's great for us here in the south when you need just a little bit of warmth in the bed versus running a furnace or heater. Excellent quality. Washes up beautifully. Controls could be improved. I don't much care for the dial to change the setting, but all in all it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice buy.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my grams for the winter times. She said it's wonderful and has no problem with it. The only thing that i didn't like about it is where the whirs are plug into the mattress pad. It's in the Middle and of the mat. They should have added it on the side, Down more from your mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M.
